text: is a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Fujita was born in Fukuoka Prefecture on June 22, 1987. After graduating from Fukuoka University, he joined J2 League club Sagan Tosu in 2010. He played many matches as defensive midfielder from his first season. Tosu got second place in the 2011 season and were promoted to J1 League for the first time in the club's history. In 2016, he moved to Vissel Kobe. In 2019, he moved to Cerezo Osaka. In July 2015, Fujita was selected for the Japan national team for 2015 East Asian Cup. At this tournament, he debuted against South Korea on August 5. ==Club statistics== .Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑ハンディ版 2018 (NSK MOOK)", 7 February 2018, Japan, (p. 74 out of 289)Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "2016J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑", 10 February 2016, Japan, (p. 100 out of 289) Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Other Other Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup J.
